radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is dilated and fluid-filled, measuring up to 13 mm, with thickened and hyperemic walls. No evidence of perforation or fluid collection. No free intra-abdominal air. Moderate, mildly complex free fluid in the pelvis. The liver shows a focus of hyperdensity likely representing a perfusion anomaly or small hemangioma. No suspicious lesions. Normal pancreas, spleen, kidneys, and adrenal glands. No lymphadenopathy or vascular abnormalities.
